info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 04 at 6:57AM EST until February 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Snow expected. Blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. * WHERE...Northern Erie, Southern Erie and Crawford counties. * WHEN...Until noon EST today. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Significant impacts continue across Northwest Pennsylvania from the winter storm. These impacts include closed and impassible roadways and blowing and drifting snow to several feet in some locations. Light snow will continue through the morning hours, but improvements will continue over the next several hours and conditions should not get any worse. Therefore, the Winter Storm Warning has been replaced with a Winter Weather Advisory through Noon.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts Pennsylvania roadways. Visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway, and traffic conditions.
